intro: Onosma echioides var. alpicola, commonly known as the alpine onosma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and the European Alps, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and is adapted to cold, high-altitude climates. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
